title: Hell House LLC
review: Once you know the overarching premise explained at the start, this becomes a straightforward by-the-numbers jump scare exercise. But it successfully made me jump so I can't complain too much. In the end its most memorable quality is its name. I wish I was given a better idea of the layout of the house. I'm not sure why but I like to know the geography/layout of a scene. E.g the Barbarian house.
